name: core-dropdown-menu
title: Core dropdown menu
description:
`core-dropdown-menu` works together with `core-dropdown` and `core-selector` to
implement a drop-down menu. The currently selected item is displayed in the
control. If no item is selected, the `label` is displayed instead.

The child element with the class `dropdown` will be used as the drop-down
menu. It should be a `core-dropdown` or other overlay element. You should
also provide a `core-selector` or other selector element, such as `core-menu`,
in the drop-down.

Example:

    <core-dropdown-menu label="Choose a pastry">
        <core-dropdown class="dropdown">
            <core-selector>
              <core-item label="Croissant"></core-item>
              <core-item label="Donut"></core-item>
              <core-item label="Financier"></core-item>
              <core-item label="Madeleine"></core-item>
            </core-selector>
        </core-dropdown>
    </core-dropdown-menu>

label.name: label
label.description: A label for the control. The label is displayed if no item is selected.
label.title: Label

openedIcon.name: openedIcon
openedIcon.description: The icon to display when the drop-down is opened.
openedIcon.title: Opened icon

closedIcon.name: closedIcon
closedIcon.description: The icon to display when the drop-down is closed.
closedIcon.title: Closed icon

core-select.name: core-select
core-select.description:
Fired when an item's selection state is changed. This event is fired both
when an item is selected or deselected. The `isSelected` detail property
contains the selection state.
core-select.title: Core select

isSelected.name: isSelected
isSelected.description: true for selection and false for deselection
isSelected.title: Is selected
